data.title: vim nvH and nvL do not work correctly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.4.0-insider (fc167f86c1aee27951b7d4b4db51229f62d0a0ad, 2016-07-26T05:12:44.554Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-28-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
#9699

These do not seem to function correctly:
- nvH Select till first non white space character of nth line from the top of the view
- nvL Select till first non white space character of nth line from the bottom of the view

Both seem to select to outside the view.

data.title: vim vg0, vg^ and vg$ should include the character at the end of the line in the selection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.4.0-insider (fc167f86c1aee27951b7d4b4db51229f62d0a0ad, 2016-07-26T05:12:44.554Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-28-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
#9699

Not sure if this is an extension, sample extension or API issue?

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file
2. Go to a line with content
3. <kbd>end</kbd>
4. Type `vg0`, notice the character at the end is not included in the selection (unlike when running `vim`)
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/17148276/5770a794-531b-11e6-8e57-cdb9c27e9f89.png)

And
1. Go to beginning `0`
2. Type `vg$`, notice that character at the end is not included

And
1. Go to beginning `0`
2. Type `vg_`, notice that non white space character at the end is included, BUT, cursor position is on next character

data.title: After uninstalling extension dialog button wording
data.body:
Sometimes I don't want to restart VS Code right now. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/17148247/3980dab0-531b-11e6-967d-a515fbce405c.png)

For example, if I am uninstalling a couple of extensions I want to uninstall each of them and restart once I am finished. 

What if we changed "Close" to "Later"? Or something like that indicating that I will have the extensions installed / uninstalled at another time.

data.title: Restore Previous Commit Message on Undo Last Commit
data.body:
This relates to issue #6190.

I've gone ahead and [reimplemented the `getLog` method](https://github.com/bill-mybiz/vscode/commit/8a92ee5aa3292f1383d15f12d09a52260a28b521), modeling almost exactly the `getCommitTemplate` method along the way. 

I've also [implemented the consuming part of this](https://github.com/bill-mybiz/vscode/commit/4753a000aefa9bb766012d3c6b6011c34b939353) similar as before, using `IStorageService`. I adjusted it to avoid the bug of blanking out the commit msg when unstaging a file. It also works for consecutive calls to "Undo Last Commit".

If you think there is a better way than using `IStorageService`, then it should be easy enough to change with how I separated these two commits. As it is though, it is working on my machine (Ubuntu 16.04).

data.title: Travis builds post coverage info to coveralls.io and add README badge.
data.body:
Seems vscode already has istanbul instrumentation enabled in tests. It would be nice to see the coverage info as a badge in the REPO readme.

You'll need to add the following environment vars in travis.

COVERALLS_REPO_TOKEN = XXXX (Generate from https://coveralls.io/repos/118314/regenerate_token)
COVERALLS_GIT_COMMIT = HEAD

data.title: Can't install extensions or use TLS/SSL behind corporate decrypting firewall without strictSSL=false

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows 7 Professional 64-bit Service Pack 1 (6.1.7601)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Search for extensions.
2. Click "Install".
3. The extension never switches from "Installing" to "Uninstall".

---
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insider
- Commit fc167f86c1aee27951b7d4b4db51229f62d0a0ad
- Date 2016-07-26T05:09:25.359Z
- Shell 0.37.6
- Renderer 49.0.2623.75
- Node 5.10.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Search for extensions.
2. Click "Install".
3. "Error: self signed certificate in certificate chain"

---

We use a decrypting firewall, which requires adding a local cert as a trusted authority.

For some really dumb reason, both VS and VS Code do not seem to use the Windows list of Trusted Authorities, where the certs were placed by group policy. Right now we can choose just not to use any SSL content (all extensions tried so far), or disable all SSL checking (`strict-ssl=false` in user settings), which would be wildly irresponsible. So that's a huge hassle.

We really need either VS Code to honor imported Trusted Authorities from the Windows cert store, or a way to import a trusted cert into VS Code's special, unique snowflake cert store.

data.title: Expanding a folder in the Explorer tab resulted in sub-tree being inserted in wrong spot
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce: I have no idea, sorry :(. But here's what I did prior to this bug happening, although I don't know if any of it is relevant:
- commit+push, leaving a comparison window open
- switch branches in VSC to a branch where the committed file does not yet exist
- switch branches _in terminal_ outside of VSC

Sorry about the weird description in the title, it's the best I could make of it, but here's a screencapture:

![wat](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/259840/17141916/60febaac-534e-11e6-9f54-7af900a2d524.gif)

I "fixed" it by closing/opening VSC, but it's still weird behaviour that might hint at a deeper bug.

data.title: tabCompletion interferes with quickSuggest
data.body:
Testing #9698
- open JS file
- type 'for'
- TAB

-> you do not get the for snippet, but 'for' gets completed with the keyword 'for' (when autoSuggest is not loaded yet, then it works.)

Minimal fix is to recommend to disable quick suggest when you want to have tab completion.

data.title: Feature request: API for managing folding area
data.body:
We are adding commands for fold/unfolding code in Vim and it turns out that Code's APIs are somewhat limited. All Vim's folding commands can be categorized as below.
## Close/Open Folds (Done)

Vim allows users to open/close folds under cursor. Users can also decide how deep the folds are opened or closed.

These commands are partially supported, we have `editor.fold`, `editor.unfold`, `editor.foldRecursively`, etc and it's easy to map them to Vim commands. Besides, Code supports us to `fold` from level 1 to level 5 but level 6 and above is not supported and we don't have similar commands for `unfold`.

Vim even supports us to toggle Fold. We don't have this command in Code and we can't use `editor.fold` or `editor.unfold` to workaround as we have no idea whether we are inside a folding area.

``` javascript
executeCommand('editor.fold, {levels: 3});
```

``` javascript
executeCommand('editor.unfold, {levels: 3});
```
## Fold creation/deletion

Vim allows users to create or delete folds manually. It's not possible here as Code is doing this for us.
## Navigate through Folds

We can navigate to previous or next fold area through commands in Vim. If we want to implement this in Code, we need to know the info about all folds.
## Fold options

We can configure max/min screen lines for a fold, max level for folds, etc in Vim. Again, we didn't expose them in Code.

---

There are about 20+ unique commands and 10+ options about folding and we can only implement 5 of them partially right now.

data.title: Top level suggestions for tsconfig schema do not make sesne
data.body:
Refs: #9744

insiders, os x
1. Have a myjson.json with the following content

``` json
| trigger intelli-sense here
{
"$schema": "http://json.schemastore.org/tsconfig"
}
```
1. trigger intelisense outside of the object, notice bogu proposals
2. I am only getting this if I choose the tsconfig schema so the problem might be with the schema and not with us, but still creating issue so you are aware

![screen shot 2016-07-26 at 15 18 09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/17139354/5f3974f0-5344-11e6-883d-71648f1930b0.png)

data.title: Lots of bogus proposals for $schema after editing $schema value
data.body:
Refs: #9744
- VSCode Version: insiders
- OS Version: os x

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new file myjson.json, trigger intelli-sense for $schema, choose first proposal
2. Delete the first proposal character by character, trigger intelli-sense again, notice a bunch of bogus proposals. Seems like you remember all the past values of the property while I was deleting it

![schemaproposals](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/17139073/465733e2-5343-11e6-99a3-656b99287f53.gif)

data.title: Unable to install coreclr-debug on Elementary OS
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.3.1 and Version 1.4.0-insider
- OS Version: Elementary OS Freya 0.3.2

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Elementary OS
2. Install Visual Studio Code
3. Install C# extension
4. Load a .NET Core project
5. Attempt to debug the project

Able to see the error log when the developer console is open within Visual Studio Code.
Should this not install correctly even if using Elementary OS? 
Elementary OS is built on Ubuntu 14.04.

Thanks very much.

data.title: Enter not an accept character in suggestions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: insiders
- OS Version: os x

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  open any file and trigger suggest widget
2.  try to accept a suggestion by pressing enter
3. instead a new line is entered in the editor and the suggest widget is still open
